passages.name: Knife Fight Two
passages.text: One of the thugs made a grab, and got a slashed hand for his trouble. She cut the other on on the arm, before he had a hold of her knife hand. He took a sharp kick to the balls, and she was able to twist free, and sprint for the elevator.\nPlasma bolts flew past her head. She would be a sitting duck in the elevator as it went [[back up to the surface]]. Was there [[anywhere else]] to go?\n

passages.name: The Great Plain
passages.text:
Tanya turned and looked out of the window. There was something quite surreal about the turquoise sand that covered everything. //There isn't much on this god-awful planet apart from the turquoise sand,// thought Tanya ruefully, //except the turquoise rocks.//
Her attention to the mundane was interrupted… Was there something moving?
Tanya could see dust being thrown up, but it was a few moments until she could see the vehicle causing it. Squat, grey and six-wheeled, with a turret on top and heading to intercept. She knew trouble when she saw it.
The turret spat a fireball. A moment later, a loud bang somewhere ahead of the transit unit. Tanya heard the brakes squealing, and then a sudden impact threw her against the front of the unit. Tanya wildly grabbed for a handrail, and hung on as the transit unit tumbled end over end. It came to rest at last, a [[tangled mess|A Tangled Mess]] of steel and plastic.

passages.name: Sneak To Vehicle
passages.text: Giving the transit unit a wide berth, she circled around to the grey vehicle.\nIt was an old Mantis K32, modified for desert use - though not on this planet, presumably, or it would be turquoise too. She climbed in, and saw the key was there. She could just [[drive it back|Drive To Landing]] to Landing herself, but if she [[hid in the back|Stowaway]] she might find out where they were from. Or get herself killed...\n

passages.name: Report the Murder
passages.text: She decided it would be best to report the murder - the last thing she wanted was to get accused of it herself. She was about to use her wrist-phone, then remembered there was no reception outside Landing. There was a phone on the middle desk, however; the site must have a direct link. She found a number, and called the cops, explaining what she had found. They said they would be there within twenty minutes. Ideally, she would not be, thought Tanya. Time to look at the [[pyramid|Pyramid Entrance]]

passages.name: The Usquil-da
passages.text:
Tanya was taken into a darkened room, dominated by a fishtank. 'So where is he?' she asked.
He pointed at the fishtank.
Something was moving in there, flowing across the bottom. It came right up to the glass, mottled brown and tentacled, it was hard to work out exactly what it was.
'Greetings;' a female voice from a speaker above the tank. 'I am Li-yl, of the Usquil-da.'
'Er, hi. I've never seen an Usquil-da before.'
'I am an Usquil, but I am of the Usquil-da. And please, do not ask if you can share this tank.'
'What? Why would I do that?'
'To our shame, certain of my race... indulge humans, men and women both. Not the Usquil-da, of course, but the clanless.'
Tanya was not sure she wanted to know any more. 'You wanted to [[know about the package|Usquil-da Package]]?'

passages.name: Stowaway
passages.text:
There were four storage bins at the back, and one was almost empty. She tossed some spades and a pickaxe out of the vehicle, hoping the men would not notice them, then climbed into the bin. It was cramped, but not too uncomfortable; she hoped it would not be a long journey.
She could hear voices and the Mantis wobbled on its suspension as each of the men climbed in. 'All I'm saying is I'm glad I'm not telling him,' one of the said.
'Just shut up,' said another. There was a pause, then; 'Er, boss, we couldn't find the package. ... yeah, I know. ... Dead. ... Just her. ... Yes, I'm sure! ... Okay.'
'Was he pissed?'
'What do you think?' The engine was started up, and the Mantis started to move, turning sharply to the left, then heading more or less straight - as far as Tanya could tell - over the rough desert. She checked her phone. 'God-damn planet,' she muttered as she realised she had no signal. This had to be the only planet in civilised space that did not have global net coverage. So much for global positioning... //Nothing to do but [[enjoy the ride|Stowaway 2]]//, she thought.

passages.name: Take The Mantis
passages.text:
She got to the Mantis, and jumped in quickly.
<<if visitedTag("Injured") >>
The suspension on the Mantis was shot to hell, and every bump in the road sent a storm of fire though her shoulder - but at least plasma wounds were self cauterising and she was not loosing blood.
<<endif>>
She headed back to the wrecked transit unit, as best she could guess, then turned right when she hit the transit tracks and followed them, keeping a steady speed and made it to [[Landing|Toytown]] in little over an hour and a half.

passages.name: Untitled Passage 1
passages.text: [[Offices]]

passages.name: keep it
passages.text:
Tanya put the cylinder in a pocket, just as the first mercenary rounded the corner. She flicked the knife out, planting it in his neck. He slumped to the ground, blood gurgling in his throat.
The other guy was not as stupid; he stood a little way away, his plasma rifle trained on her.
'Sorry about your friend,' said Tanya.
'Just give me the device.'
Tanya took it from her pocket. 'This?' She tossed it too him in a high arc, leaping at him as his eyes tracked its trajectory. A kick to the knee, a headbutt to his nose and a strike to his windpipe, and he dropped to the ground. Not dead, but not strong enough to resist as she took the plasma rifle from him.
Now to sabotage the reactor. Just as she had at the mercenary camp, she disabled the safety systems, then started it ramping up.
She picked the device up from where it had landed, and jumped into the [[elevator]].

passages.name: Head To Vehicle
passages.text: The vehicle the men had used was an old Mantis K32, modified for desert use - though not on this planet, presumably, or it would be turquoise too. She climbed in, and saw the key was there. Now she could [[drive it back|Drive To Landing]] to Landing.\n

passages.name: Nguyen Attack (Injured)
passages.text:
Tanya leapt at the man, seeing the surprise in his face. He pulled the trigger - once, twice, three times before she had reached him, and by then she was dead.
Rating: 3/10
Tanya failed and died, but you got some way though, I guess.

passages.name: Hand it over to the cops
passages.text:
Tanya located the police station, and made her way there. At the desk, she talked to the officer on duty. 'I've been given this package, and people are killing to get hold of it.' <>The officer looked up in surprise, then narrowed his eyes. 'You hold it right there, miss.' 'What?' He was pulling a gun on her. 'No, no. You've got it all wrong.' 'Put you hands up, miss. Nice and slow. Half the cops in the city are out looking for the girl who smashing through an official roadblock in an armoured vehicle.' 'Oh, shit.' She had forgotten about that. It was two weeks later before everything was sorted, and Tanya was released after paying a hefty fine. She never saw the silver cylinder again, but she did not care. She had realised the Lucian's were gods. Tanya worshiped them, as was only right, and she would do anything for them. <> The officer listened carefully as she explained what happened, then she had to tell another, high ranking office, who took the cylinder off her. Then that was that. Job done, and out of her hands. Two weeks later she realised the Lucians had got hold of the device. But that was okay, they were gods; Tanya worshipped them, as was only right, and Tanya would do anything for them. <>
Rating: 7/10
Tanya survived, but the Lucians have enslaved all sentient races. Never a good thing.

passages.name: Access Computers
passages.text:
Computer security was not her area of expertise, but the weak point in any system was the user. The last user logged on was apparently "montyk"; she started to guess passwords, looking round for inspiration. A photo of a dog called "Nails". Weird name, but worth a try. That was a no-go. She tried a few variations of "password" and "pyramid", but without luck.
<<if visitedTag("Students") >>
Then she remembered talking to the students at the university. What had that thing been? A research project on something - or someone - called Kaldashin. She tried various spellings... and suddenly [[she was in|Hacked Computer]].
<<else>>
She gave a shrug; looked like this was not going to work. Time to look at the [[pyramid|Pyramid Entrance]].<<endif>>

passages.name: StoryTitle
passages.text: The God Device

passages.name: Get Rid Of Oscar
passages.text:
'It's getting late,' said Tanya, 'I should really be getting back to my hotel.'
'I'll walk there with you.'
'That's okay, I can find it myself.'
<<if visitedTag("Disguised") >>
For a moment he looked as if he was considering making a big deal about it, then thought better of it, and went to the bar muttering something about "bitches".
She headed back to the hotel, and got a good night's sleep, waking feeling much refreshed. She got out of bed, ready to [[get dressed|Get Dressed]].
<<else>>
'Okay. Whatever. Guess I should go too.' He headed out of the bar, and a few moments later Tanya followed.
He was waiting for her, now brandishing a gun; a Micrimaser-712 by the look of it. Not powerful, but easy to conceal, and deadly enough.
'It would've been easier,' he said, 'if we'd gone to your hotel.'
'I love to make things difficult.'
'Just hand over the cylinder.'
'What? I thought you wanted my body... Now I'm insulted. So how did you find me?'
'Chick in a black jumpsuit, poking around the university. You weren't hard to trace. Now, [[give me the cylinder|Nguyen Give Cylinder]].'
<<if visitedTag("Injured")>>
Tanya eyed him up. He was probably not expecting her to [[attack him|Nguyen Attack (Injured)]], but it would be risky to say the least, especially with a her shoulder already injured.
<<else>>
Tanya eyed him up. He was probably not expecting her to [[attack him|Nguyen Attack]]... 
<<endif>>
<<endif>>

passages.name: anywhere else
passages.text: Tanya skidded round the back of the elevator, protected for a moment by its lift mechanism. it was powered by a Helios microreactor, she found. Could she sabotage this one too? And if she did, should she [[leave the cylinder]] here, to make sure it was destroyed, or [[keep it]] for herself.\n

passages.name: Walk To Uni
passages.text:
//Why did a pisshole like Kostam III even have a university,// wonderd Tanya as she entered the campus.
The package was addressed to Prof. Jenssen in the Xenoarchaeology Department, and according to the sign, that was the large glass building in the centre of the campus. 
Tanya hiked up to the third floor in search of Jenssen's office.  She passed a large display case which showed off some very peculiar artefacts, including a green, spiked helix and collection of silver cubes.  They seemed to be moving until you looked right at them at which point they became quite still. Tanya noticed a couple of [[students|Student Notes]] eyeing the display and taking notes.  She wondered if they knew what they were.
[[Jenssen's office|Jenssen Office]] was just ahead.

passages.name: Take The Mantis (Explosion)
passages.text: A few minutes later, a huge explosion jolted the Mantis, and moments later there was a shower of sand. She smiled.\nShe headed back to the transit unit, as best she could guess, then turned right when she hit the transit tracks and followed them, keeping a steady speed and made it to [[Landing|Toytown]] in little over an hour and a half.

passages.name: Pyramid Entrance
passages.text:
Once inside the pyramid, Tanya found herself on a metal platform. This was clearly an elevator the researchers had installed. Looking over the side, she could see the floor of the chamber perhaps 300 meters below.
A press of the button, and the platform was slowly descending. Tanya kept a careful watch, but could see no signs of life below her.
As the elevator stopped, she stepped out. Now she could see the chamber properly.
It was big, probably over half a klick across. The pyramid visible above ground was just the tip of the proverbial iceberg. Here and there were structures that might be machinery or could as easily be houses.  They were irregular in size and shape, seemingly made of plastic, and various shades of red, orange and yellow.
Tanya walked over to one, and ran a hand over the smooth surface.
<<if visitedTag("Explosion") >>'What have we here,' said a man behind her. She turned. Two mercenaries, dressed in the same grey uniform as the men who had attacked the transit unit. 'I know some [[people want to meet you|Lucians Meeting Two]]. And we've a personal score to settle too. Your little explosion killed a lot of our friends.'
'A lot of them,' the other one confirmed.<<else>>'What have we here,' said a man behind her. She turned. There were five of them, mercenaries Tanya guessed, dressed in the same grey uniform as the men who had attacked the transit unit. The guy talking looked to be the leader. 'I know some [[people want to meet you|Lucians Meeting Two]].'<<endif>>

passages.name: Knife Fight Two Injured
passages.text:
One of the thugs made a grab, and got a slashed hand for his trouble she cut the other on the arm, before he had a hold of her knife hand. He took a sharp kick to the balls, but kept hold, and in moments she was on the floor under them. Her knife was tossed aside, and the cylinder handed to the Lucians. And suddenly all her confusion evaporated, as she comprehended what they were. These beings were gods! She would give her life for them a thousand times over. 'Kneel!' Surely they were not talking to her? Yes, they really were. She and the mercenaries all knelt. 'You shall be our first missionaries...' For the rest of her life, Tanya toured the galaxy, spreading the word, leaving peace and happiness wherever she went.
Rating: 9/10
Well, everyone is happy, I suppose... And she did survive.

passages.name: A Tangled Mess
passages.text: Tanya caught her breath. She realised that, besides a few minor cuts and bruises, she was okay. She had escaped much worse in the corps, that was for sure. She looked at the other woman, who did not look so good. Outside, she could hear a vehicle come to a stop, and men shouting.\nTanya peered out of the wrecked transit unit. There were three men she could see, dressed in grey, the same shade as the vehicle, and armed with plasma rifles. Tanya looked at the woman, she should really [[check her|Check The Woman]] before doing anything else.

passages.name: Toytown
passages.text: The city of Landing was just ahead. //‘City’ was a bit of a misnomer,// Tanya reflected, //it had a population of less than fifty-thousand.// Built of the turquoise rock, perhaps toytown was a better word.\nIf she drove [[straight to the university|Go Straight to Uni]] she might be asking for trouble. It might be better to stop here, and [[walk into the city|Walk Into City]].

passages.name: The Other Mantis
passages.text:
The other Mantis was closer, so she sneaked over to it. She could now see there was a man working underneath it. 'Hey, pass me the off-wrench, will you?' Apparently she had not been as quiet as she had hoped. She picked up the tool, hoping he would not notice who she was... He started to slide out. 'Hey, who are...' 
She struck him with the wrench, laying him out cold, then tossed it on the ground beside him. 'One off-wrench, just like you asked for.'
A very brief search of his body turned up nothing of interest. Did she investigate [[the tents now|The Tents]], or [[the trailers|The Trailers]]? Or cut her losses, and [[leave the camp|Take The Mantis]] while she could?

passages.name: Nguyen ONS
passages.text:
On the other hand, perhaps some meaningless sex would take her mind off the damn cylinder. 'Sure. Double scotch.'
The man got her the drink, then sat down at her table. 'I'm Oscar. I'm an AgBot salesman, just passing through.'
'Tanya. I've been here two months, so I guess that makes me the expert.' They chatted for a while; he was a nice guy but little things he said did not make sense. Why was he selling farming robots on a planet famous for no plant life?
It was getting late, should she [[invite him to her hotel room|Invite Oscar To Hotel]], or try to [[get rid of him|Get Rid Of Oscar]]?

links.text: invite him to her hotel room

passages.name: header
passages.text: data:image/png;base64,

passages.name: Lucians Want It
passages.text:
'What is it, exactly?'
'Do you even know what it is?' the orb said. 'It is the god-device of the Relv'gat. The one who wields it will be considered a god by most of the sentient races.'
'I'm not sure we really want a god...'
'But it is our destiny. We have evolved into the niche the Relv'gat built for us.'
'So let me see if I have this right. I give you this god-device, and then you guys set yourselves up as the gods of the universe.'
'Do not worry, Tanya, we will ensure that everyone is happy. It is only right that your gods look after you. We will be perfect rulers. [[Greed, lust and corruption are impossible|Greed And Lust]] for the Lucians. We will lead the galaxy into an eternity of prosperity, a galaxy where all races live in peace and harmony.'
If they were looking to be gods, that put [[the price up ten-fold|Pay For It]], thought Tanya.

links.text: Greed, lust and corruption are impossible

passages.name: Get Changed
passages.text: There were exactly two hotels in Landing, an upmarket one, and a down-market one. Tanya was in the latter, an ugly concrete block. Trying not to draw attention to herself, she headed quickly to her room.\nOnce out of the jumpsuit, she put on some denim shorts and a crop top with a stylised smile on it. Then she put her boots back on - she had too many useful things hidden in them - and her wrist-phone. Now she looked just like a student. She glanced in the mirror. Well, a mature student anyway. Not that the guys would be looking at her face. She put on a baseball cap to finish the effect. Now did she take the [[package to the university|Walk To Uni]] or [[open it herself|Open The Package]]? Or just [[get the hell out|Get Out]] of here?

passages.name: Get Out
passages.text:
People were dead over this thing. It was not Tanya's problem, she decided. She dropped the package in a mailbox, and caught the next shuttle off-planet.
Rating: 3/10
Tanya failed, but she did survive.

passages.name: Spaceport After Lucian
passages.text: Okay, so the device was very important to some dubious people. Tanya weighed up her options<<if visitedTag("LeftLuggage") >>, as she took the device out of the locker<<endif>>. She could [[head to the pyramid|Head To Pyramid]], see if there were any scientist-types there who might know more about the cylinder.\nPerhaps she should just [[hand it over to the cops|Hand it over to the cops]] and let them deal with it. Could she trust them? She was not sure she could.\nShe was already at the spaceport. Her best option might be to just [[get off-planet|Jump Ship]] fast. <<if visitedTag("HotelAttack")>>There was also the matter of the corpse in her hotel room; another reason to leave the planet sooner rather than later.<<endif>>

links.text: hand it over to the cops

destination.name: Hand it over to the cops

passages.name: Walk Into City
passages.text: Tanya stopped the Mantis on the outskirts of the city, and walked in.\n<<if visitedTag("DogTag") >>She had a signal on her phone at last, and could look up that ident code she had found on one of the mercenaries. She knew a site that had access to certain unprotected databases, and after a few tries got lucky. The guy was called Lantern Jackson, and he was with a merc group called the Running Jaguars. Another site suggests they might be doing work for the Lucians, and yet another site informed her the Lucians were a race of floating orbs. She wondered if any of that was useful.\n<<endif>>Nearer to the centre of the city, many of the buildings were built of steel, concrete and glass, a refreshing chance from the ubiquitous turquoise. The [[university|Walk To Uni]] was on the north side of the city, but she wondered if she should go to her hotel room first and [[get changed|Get Changed]]; who knew who might be looking for a woman in a black jumpsuit.

passages.name: Sabotage The Reactor
passages.text: The Helios microreactor was so successful in part because it was so difficult to sabotage; they had been known to survive even a plasma cannon - not in working condition, but without exploding. Fortunately, Tanya knew a trick or two; you just had to be a bit more subtle. As she had suspected, they were only using 3% of its potential. She disabled a couple of safety trips, and shorted the outputs. All she had to do then was put it into a diagnostic mode that ramped up the power; a slow ramp would give her about five minutes to get clear.\nShe made her way quickly but quietly back to the Mantis, and jumped in. 'This thing better start up quick,' she muttered as she fired up the engines. She turned it 180 degrees, and [[headed out into the desert|Take The Mantis (Explosion)]].

passages.name: Hacked Computer
passages.text:
Tanya scanned the directory listing, looking for anything useful. A folder called reports; she opened up the latest.
Report 14/2519 Psi-spec analysis of artefact P-441 indicates it may be rather more significant than first thought. High amplitude peaks in the C- and R-zones suggest the device has a very wide area of effect on most intelligent agents, specifically on the temporal lobes on humans and equivalent structures in other intelligent species. Could this be the so-called "God Device" hypothesised by Manigault?1 The existence of such a device is indicated by texts in the pyramid, but has previously been considered unlikely.2 However, some direct experience suggests the device is readily used, and simply requires the user to channel his or her thoughts through the device. There is some concern at the wider implications of the device, and we recommend secure storage at the university be a priority. 1. J Manigault, J.Xen.Res, 14(4), 2513 2. L Geroud and SLK Ho, J.Xen.Tech.Rev, 312, 2503
Tanya was not sure if that was useful or not, but it was clear the device was a recent find, and there was nothing else that looked relevant with a recent timestamp in the files. Time to look at the [[pyramid|Pyramid Entrance]].

passages.name: The Tents
passages.text:
Tanya crept up to the nearest tent, and listened. Nothing. She took her boot knife, and slowly cut a hole at about knee height, and looked inside. No one there, just some bunks.
The next two were the same. She turned her attention to the central tent.
She could hear voices, two men talking about what they would spend their credits on. Tanya doubted they would find that sort of entertainment on Kostam III.
As before, she cut a small hole in the tent wall, and looked inside. There were six men altogether, all sat at a long table, drinking from metal mugs.
She guessed the leader was the one in the cap. 'Shut your yapping,' he said. 'Got a call from the customer coming in.' He picked up a handset, and his rough voice suddenly became smooth. 'A pleasure to hear from you again, are you well? ... Of course, of course. ... We attacked the transit just as you asked, but it wasn't there. ... Yes, it was definitely her. My men are very thorough. ... Well maybe she didn't have it. ... No, only her. ... Oh? Could you hold the line for a moment.' He pressed a button on the handset. 'They say someone else was on the transit.'
'No way boss,' said one of the others. Tanya thought she recognised his voice.
'They saw her get on the transit at Base 42, a woman, cropped hair, black jumpsuit, and it didn't stop until you made it stop. What happened to her?'
Damn, they knew about her. Tanya wondered if [[she should go|Take The Mantis]] now before they started to search for her. 
<<if visited("The Trailers") >>Did she had time to [[sabotage the reactor|Sabotage The Reactor]]?
<<endif>> Or should she [[stay and listen|The Tents 2]] to more?

passages.name: Get Dressed
passages.text:
Tanya turned on a news channel as she dressed, hearing a report of the attack on the transit.
<<if visitedTag ("DogTag") >>"Professor Kimura was on her way to Landing from the site at Pyramid Plot when the incident happened. Three other bodies were recovered from the site, though there seems to be some confusion about how they died. KLE are investigating the cause of the incident, and have yet to make any official announcement.
<<elseif visitedTag ("OneDead") >>"Professor Kimura was on her way to Landing from the site at Pyramid Plot when the incident happened. Another body was recovered from the site, though there seems to be some confusion about how he died. KLE are investigating the cause of the incident, and have yet to make any official announcement.
<<else>>"Professor Kimura was on her way to Landing from the site at Pyramid Plot when the incident happened. KLE are investigating the cause of the incident, and have yet to make any official announcement.
<<endif>>"Transit line officials say the line is now open again, though passengers may experience some delays.
<<if visitedTag ("Explosion") >>"Investigation of the nuclear explosion yesterday has been hampered by high radiation levels at the site, though satellite imagery has indicated an armoured vehicle, a Mantis, arrived at the site shortly before, and left seconds before the explosion.
<<endif>>"Industrial action at the Langdon water plant seems to have been averted..."
Once dressed, she decided her first course of action was to find a [[cheap breakfast|Cheap breakfast]].

passages.name: elevator no device
passages.text:
'Stop!' said a familiar voice in her head. 'Not a chance,' said Tanya, trying to work out where the Lucians were. Bastards could fly! There they were, down at the lift mechanism, right where the device had landed. Tanya pointed the plasma rifle at one, and pulled the trigger. Nothing happened. 'Fuck!' she screamed in frustration, the weapon was biometrically locked. She threw it at the floating orbs, but they easily avoided it. At least they seemed uninterested in her now, thought Tanya, as the lift reached the top. She jumped out, sprinting for the exit; she only had seconds, she estimated... Suddenly she stopped. She had been wrong about the Lucians, oh so very wrong. They gods! Wonderful, incredible gods, and they deserved only her worship! The ground shook as the reactor exploded, the blast throwing the elevator up into the sky. And just as suddenly, Tanya knew the Lucians were //not// Gods.
Rating: 10/10
Tanya survived, and the Lucians and the device were both destoyed!

passages.name: Open The Package
passages.text: It would be better if she opened the package, she decided. In shorts and top, she could not conceal the envelope anymore; she might be able to conceal the contents.\nInside there was a note and a metallic cylinder. The note just said "Jamal was right!" which told her exactly nothing. Now she really should [[take the cylinder to the university|Walk To Uni]], [[shouldn't she|Keep Package]]?

links.text: take the cylinder to the university

passages.name: Hide from Men
passages.text:
Tanya slipped out of the transit unit on the opposite side to the men, and ran. There were some rocks not far away, and though they were not big, she could hide behind them. She crouched down low, shifting some of the cyan sand to make a small hollow, then kept still.
She listened carefully.
A gun discharged.
It would take them a while to search for the package in the wreckage, time Tanya could perhaps use to [[sneak to their vehicle|Sneak To Vehicle]]. Or would it be safer to [[stay out of sight|Walk to Landing]] until they were safely gone?

passages.name: Walk to Landing
passages.text:
Tanya waited several minutes, until she heard the vehicle start up again. After a few moments, the sound was dwindling as it headed away.
Tanya stood, and checked back inside the transit unit. The woman was dead; the men had finished her off. For a moment Tanya felt bad about not trying to help her, but realistically they would have both been dead if she had tried.
<<if visitedTag("Injured")>>Her shoulder aching, she<<else>>She<<endif>> started the long walk to the city. The transit rails were straight, and she could follow them all the way.
At last she could see the city of Landing just ahead. City was a bit of a misnomer, Tanya reflected, it had a population of less than 50,000. Built of the turquoise rock, perhaps toytown was a better word.
Nearer to the centre of the city, many of the buildings were built of steel, concrete and glass; Tanya was getting sick of turquoise everywhere. The [[university|Walk To Uni]] was on the north side of the city, but she wondered if she should go to her hotel room first and [[get changed|Get Changed]]; who knew who might be looking for a woman in a black jumpsuit?

passages.name: Students About Jamal
passages.text: 'You guys know someone called Jamal? A professor maybe?'\nThe boy looked blank, but the girl spoke for the first time. 'Professor Manigault, I'm pretty sure he's called Jamal.'\n'Thanks. Now I do [[need to go|Jenssen Office]].'

passages.name: Nguyen Another
passages.text:
Tanya shrugged. 'Sure, why not?' The waitress returned a few minutes later with another double scotch.
<<if visitedTag("Disguised") >>Later Tanya decided she should head [[back to her hotel|Nguyen Outside]].
Back at the hotel, she pretty much dropped straight into bed. She would worry about the package [[in the morning|Get Dressed]]
<<else>>Later Tanya decided she should head [[back to her hotel|Nguyen Outside]].<<endif>>

passages.name: leave the cylinder
passages.text:
Tanya put the cylinder on top of the reactor, just as the first mercenary rounded the corner. She flicked the knife out, planting it in his neck. He slumped to the ground, blood gurgling in his throat.
The other guy was not as stupid; he stood a little way away, his plasma rifle trained on her.
'Sorry about your friend,' said Tanya.
'Just give me the device.'
Tanya picked it up again. 'This?' She tossed it too him in a high arc, leaping at him as his eyes tracked its trajectory. A kick to the knee, a headbutt to his nose and a strike to his windpipe, and he dropped to the ground. Not dead, but not strong enough to resist as she took the plasma rifle from him.
Now to sabotage the reactor. Just as she had at the mercenary camp, she disabled the safety systems, then started it ramping up.
She jumped into the [[elevator|elevator no device]].

passages.name: Give up
passages.text: 'Okay, okay,' she said, putting up her hands, and wincing with the pain in her shoulder. 'I'll come quietly.' For a moment she thought they would shoot her anyway, but then the woman caught up with them.\n'I glad you see sense,' said the woman. 'We better get [[going|To the Lucians]].'

passages.name: Pyramid Plot
passages.text:
Tanya stepped out of the transit unit, and walked towards the pyramid. On any more civilised planet, a place like this would be crawling with security; it was quite refreshing.
To the right of the track, four cargo-pods that had been modified as offices and quarters. A bit further up, to the left, a helijet stood. At the end of the path was a seal over the [[entrance to the Pyramid|Pyramid Entrance]].
The helijet was a Westland Raptor-3033. Tanya could see no identification on it, which was odd, but perhaps it was not necessary here. For all she knew it was the only aircraft on the planet. As she got nearer, she could feel the heat of the engines; it had been used in the last couple of hours - presumably because the transit line had still been down.
The [[cargo-pods|Offices]] were arranged with three in a 'U' shape and the fourth on top of the middle one, which was also where the only door was. Short joining sections linked them to each other. There were small windows on all of them, but she could see no sign of life in them from where she stood on the path.

passages.name: Keep The Package
passages.text:
'Maybe I should hang on to it for now.'
'I really think you should leave it here, miss. I appreciate the trouble you went to, so please don't make me call security.'
<<if visitedTag("Injured") >>'Maybe you're right, I've already been shot once.' She indicated her shoulder.
The secretary went visibly pale. 'Perhaps you should keep it for now.'
<<elseif visitedTag("Opened") >>'Maybe you're right, I don't want to end up like your professor, with my face blown off.'
The secretary went visibly pale. 'Perhaps you should keep it for now.'
<<else>>Tanya handed it to the secretary, blood drenched corner first. 'Oh, pardon me, that's the professor's blood.'
The secretary went visibly pale. 'Perhaps you should keep it for now.'
<<endif>>'Well if you insist...'
<<if visitedTag("JamalIdentified") >>Tanya could now try to find [[Professor Manigault]], or [[leave the university|Leave The University]]. 
<<else>>Tanya [[left the university|Leave The University]].
<<endif>>

passages.name: Student Notes
passages.text:
'Do you know what those things are?' Tanya asked the two students.
'The helix is a necklace, of course,' the boy said. The girl giggled, and Tanya had a feeling the boy was making it up.
'Yeah, very funny. How'd they get it on?'
'The Relv'gat had mystical powers; it would just sort of materialise around their necks.'
'Who are the Relv'gat?'
'What? Are you really a student?'
'Sure!' Tanya lied.
'What are you studying?'
'Er, sociology.'
'Oh, right. Well as everyone except sociology students know, the Relv'gat ruled the galaxy about a million years ago, the only survivors of a great war. Their ruins are all over this planet, and nearly everyone at the university is studying them in one way or another. I'm part of a research project on Kaldashin.' He said it as though that was supposed to impress her.
'Thanks.' Tanya looked at [[Jenssen's door|Jenssen Office]] again. 'I better get going.'<<if visitedTag("Opened") >> Or could she ask them [[who "Jamal" was|Students About Jamal]]?<<endif>>

passages.name: Dash for door
passages.text:
She burst through the door. The two goons had their back to her, but quickly turned, raising their rifles. Even as she run passed them, she was thinking that their reactions were slow. <>She tried to vault a crate, but her injured shoulder gave way under her. As she tried to scramble into cover, she took a plasma bolt to the leg. She got to her feet, and gasped in pain, even as she lurched to towards the street. Another plasma bolt to her flank, and she fell again. Another and she was dead.
Rating: 6/10
Tanya died, and the Lucians got the cylinder. not good.
<>She vaulted a crate, briefly taking cover behind it. After a pause to catch her breath, she made a [[break for the street|Break for street]].<>

passages.name: back up to the surface
passages.text:
Tanya leapt into the elevator, punching the button, even as a plasma bolt hit her in the leg. She dropped to the floor, to get what cover she could, but another shot hit her flank, and another in the head. The mercenaries waited for the elevator to reach the surface then return to them, before retrieving the silver cylinder from Tanya's lifeless body, and handing it to the Lucians. Perhaps if there had been less mercenaries or Tanya had learnt more about the cylinder things might have been different...
Rating: 8/10
Tanya dead and the Lucians got what they wanted. Not good.

passages.name: Check The Woman
passages.text:
The other woman was in a bad way, lying in a crumpled heap on the ground. She was still alive - but might not be for long. A card on a lanyard indicated she was a Professor Kimura. She looked up at Tanya, eyes full of fear. 'Take...'
'Take? Take what?'
'Take package... jacket pocket... has address.'
'Hey, I'm sure you'll be fine,' lied Tanya.
'No... you must... take package...'
'Jacket pocket, I know.' Tanya felt around, and located the pocket, pulling out a bulging envelope, one corner scarlet with blood.
'Address...'
'Yeah, yeah.' The address was someone at the university at Landing, here on Kostam III. Tanya was heading to Landing; delivering the envelope was a simple request.
Now what to do about the men in the vehicle... A [[straight out attack|Attack]] would be risky, to put it mildly, as would trying to [[take the woman|Take the woman]]. The best option might be to just [[hide|Hide from Men]], and watch them.

passages.name: Break for street
passages.text:
Plasma bolts sizzled past her as she ran, and suddenly she felt a burning pain in her shoulder - she had been hit!
She could not let it stop her; she stumbled as she exited the building, turning quickly right, then right again, desperate to get out of their sight.
Despite the pain in her shoulder she kept running. At least plasma wounds were self-cauterising, she thought; she was not losing blood.
Three more blocks, and she paused to look back. No sign of pursuit. She walked, fast, but not enough to draw attention, for a few more blocks, until she was sure she had eluded them. She realised she was almost [[at the spaceport|Spaceport After Lucian]].

passages.name: Jenssen Office
passages.text: Tanya opened the door and entered the office.  Jenssen was “off-world and away from the office” apparently, or at least that’s what the sign on the wall above an empty desk indicated.\nThe secretary, a tall, slim man in white greeted her and said ‘If you [[leave the package|Leave The Package]], I'll make sure he gets it when he gets back.'\nSome people were going to a lot of trouble to get the package, even prepared to kill for it; Tanya wondered if it might be best to [[hang on to it|Keep The Package]], and make sure it got to who it was supposed to.

passages.name: Overpower Him
passages.text: They were getting close to the spaceport; she had to act soon. She pretended to stumble, rolled to her feet, then ducked round a corner. He chased after her, expecting her to be running for her life, but instead she was waiting for him. A quick punch to the neck, and he fell to the ground, his head vulnerable to a swift kick. He was motionless, time for [[her to go|Back To Hotel]] before people started to ask awkward questions.

passages.name: Cheap breakfast
passages.text:
<<if visitedTag ("LadyDeal") >>As soon as she stepped out of the hotel, a woman approached her - the same woman who had talked to her yesterday after leaving the university. 'Hello again,' she said. 'I took the precaution of bringing some associates.'<<else>>As soon as she stepped out of the hotel, a woman approached her. 'Good morning,' she said. 'Before we talk, can I draw your attention to my associates?'<<endif>>
Tanya looked at the two men with her. Big, dumb and armed summed them up adequately. 'What do you want?'
'To take you to the Lucians.'
<<if visitedTag ("Lucians") >>Tanya remembers the raiders talking about Lucians. <<endif>>'And if I don't come with you?'
'One of my associates will shoot you.'
'Here? Out in the street? You think you'll get away with that?'
'Rest assured I will be an innocent by-stander.'
Tanya looked at the men. Neither seemed concerned about, well, anything. Were they brain-washed or something? <<if visitedTag ("Injured") >>She had a feeling that if she [[made a run for it|Make a run for it (injured)]] they would not hesitate before killing her<<else>>More importantly, if she [[made a run for it|Make a run for it]], would they hesitate before killing her?<<endif>> Perhaps it would be safer to go [[see what these Lucians want|To the Lucians]], and learn more about them at the same time?

passages.name: StoryAuthor
passages.text: Andy Joel

passages.name: No Deal
passages.text:
'I'll think about it.'
'Of course,' said the orb, 'make sure you make the right decision.'

Tanya headed to the spaceport. The further she got from the Lucians, the less she liked them. Was this the god-mechanism hard-wired to her brain, she wondered?
Those two goons were definitely [[following her|Renege On Lucians]]. She wondered what had happened to the woman.

passages.name: Smash The Roadblock
passages.text: 'See you in hell,' grinned Tanya, as she put her foot down. The Mantis rode over the top of two cop cars, and she was on her way again. It would not be long before they were after her, and there was no way she could out run them. She took the first right, then right again, then abandoned the Mantis, and, trying to look nonchalant, [[walked to the university|Walk To Uni]].

passages.name: Style
Keep Package
passages.text: She decided it would be better if she hung on to the package for now, and rather than walk to the university, she headed out into the city centre.\nPerhaps she could get a drink, [[Nguyen's Bar|Nguyen Start]] looked enticing, after being out in the sun most of the day. Would it be wise to leave the object in a [[locker at the spaceport|Left Luggage]] first?

passages.name: Go Straight to Uni
passages.text:
Tanya decided to head straight to the University; she wanted to get rid of the package as soon as possible. She was about half way there when she hit a roadblock. Most cars were being waved through, but not her.
'Is there a problem,' she called to the nearest cop.
'Can you get out of the vehicle, ma'am.'
She toyed with the idea of [[driving straight through|Smash The Roadblock]] them; the Mantis was probably up to the job, but it might be better in the long term to <<if visitedTag("Explosion") >>
[[get everything straightened out|Get Everything Straightened Out (Fail)]]<<else>>[[get everything straightened out|Get Everything Straightened Out]]<<endif>>.

passages.name: Start
passages.text:
[>img[header]]
What is in the blood-soaked envelope the archaeologist gave Tanya just before she died?
Look at the [[credits and notes|Credits]]...
Or [[begin|Begin]]...

passages.name: The Tents 4
passages.text:
Three men emerged from the tent, heading to the Mantis. It was then she remembered she had taken the key - and about a minute later they realised it too. It was not long before she was spotted and the third plasma bolt took her down...
Rating: 1/10
Tanya failed and died.

passages.name: The Tents 2
passages.text:
'I swear there was no one else there.'
'You better be right, Jackson,' said the boss. He pressed the button on the handset. 'I was just confirming with my boys, and they're sure there was no one else there. ... I can assure... Okay, if that's what you want.' He put the handset down. 'Damn Lucians, I hate working for those oh-so-mighty bastards. If they're so god-damned wonderful, why can't they get the damn package themselves?'
'Then we'd be out of a job, boss.'
'Yeah, I guess that's true. Jackson, take your crew back to the transit.'
'There was no one there!'
'I know that and you know that, but the damn Lucians want you to search the site, so you search the site.'
Now she really [[should go|The Tents 3]]. 
<<if visited("The Trailers") >>She doubted she had time to [[sabotage the reactor|Fail To Sabotage The Reactor]] now.
<<endif>> [[Staying here|The Tents 4]] looked a bad idea.

passages.name: The Tents 3
passages.text: That was Tanya's cue to leave; she wanted that Mantis for herself. She quickly made her way back that way.\n'Hey, what the...' She had been spotted. 'Get her!'\nA plasma bolt hit the Mantis just by her head; a second caught her shoulder as she climbed in. No time to worry about that now. 'This thing better start up quick,' she muttered as she fired up the engines. She turned it 180 degrees, and [[headed off|Take The Mantis]].

passages.name: Tags
passages.text:
Ancients: She has heard about Relv'gat
Described: She knows her description is out there
Disguised: She has changed her clothes
DogTag: She got an ID from a dogtag
Explosion: She blew up the microreactor
Lucians: She knows the Lucians employed the mercs
Injured: Her shoulder took a plasma shot
Opened: She opened the package
Wanted: She ran the roadblock
PromiseLucians: She promiced the device to the Lucians
TenFold: She negotiated 10,000 with Lucians
Demo: She has seen the object in action
Uni: Visited the university
LeftLuggage: Device is in a locker

passages.name: Lucians Meeting Two
passages.text:
The three Lucians floated serenely into view. 'You have caused us some considerable trouble,' one of them said. 'We will waste no more time. Take [[the device|Become A God]] from her.'
<<if visitedTag("Explosion") >>The two mercenaries looked at her and grinned, looking entirely too happy at getting their hands on her.
<<if visitedTag("Injured") >>'You touch me and I'll break your balls,' Tanya said, backing against the strange structure. Despite her words, she was not hopeful; her shoulder still hurt from the plasma bolt earlier. As she fished [[the knife|Knife Fight Two Injured]] from her boot, the two mercs glanced at each other, smiling.
'Do as we command,' said the Lucian.
They started to edge nearer.
<<else>>'You touch me and I'll break your balls,' backing against the strange structure, even as she fished [[the knife|Knife Fight Two]] from her boot. They glanced at each other, clearly a little worried.
'Do as we command,' said the Lucian.
They started to edge nearer.
<<endif>><<else>>The mercenaries looked at her and grinned, looking entirely too happy at getting their hands on her.
'You touch me and I'll break your balls,' said Tanya, backing against the strange structure, even as she fished [[the knife|Knife Fight]] from her boot. They glanced at each other, clearly a little worried.
'Come on!' said their boss. 'All of you get her together. She's just one girl.'
Now they were edging nearer - though not the boss, she noted. She did not hold out much hope.<<endif>>

passages.name: elevator
passages.text:
'Stop!' said a familiar voice in her head. 'Not a chance,' said Tanya, trying to work out where the Lucians were. Bastards could fly! There they were, floating up to the ascending elevator. Tanya pointed the plasma rifle at one, and pulled the trigger. Nothing happened. 'Fuck!' she screamed in frustration, the weapon was biometrically locked. She threw it at the floating orbs, but they easily avoided it. 'Reverse the elevator!' There was something about the voice, Tanya almost wanted to obey it, to press the button, and go back down. The Lucians got closer, almost touching distance. 'Reverse the elevator!' Maybe it would be best to go back down. She went to press the button. No, wait. The reactor. 'Reverse the elevator!' Of course. She pressed the button, and with a lurch the elevator stopped its ascent, and started going back down. That was better... wasn't it? Why did she have this nagging doubt that going down was a bad idea? Three minutes later the reactor exploded, destroying Tanya, the device and the Lucians.
Rating: 9/10
Tanya died, but she took the Lucians with her!

passages.name: Leave The University
passages.text:
She was about a block from the university when a woman in a sharp suit approached her. 'May I have a word?'
'What's this about?'
'A package we think you have.'
'What the hell are you talking about?'
'Don't play coy. A woman with cropped hair, in a black jumpsuit got on a transit unit at Base 42. The transit unit... crashed minutes later. A hour later you arrive in Landing in a stolen Mantis...'
'Stolen?'
'... Cropped hair, black jumpsuit. Certain people are anxious to obtain that package.'
'And who might they be?'
'I'm not at liberty to say.'
'And I'm not at liberty to hand the package over someone I just met in the street, ' Tanya quipped, paused, and then thought of her options. 'But... let's suppose I did have some kind of package.'
'You would be paid 1,000 credits.'
These people had gone to a lot of trouble to get this thing, Tanya wondered if they would [[pay 10,000 credits|Yes deal]]. Then again, given their methods, perhaps it would be better to [[keep it out of their hands|No deal]], whatever it was.

links.text: keep it out of their hands

passages.name: Drive To Landing
passages.text:
<<if visitedTag("Injured") >>The Mantis groaned to a start.  She shifted it into drive, turning sharply to the right, and accelerating towards Landing.
The suspension on the Mantis was shot to hell, and every bump in the road sent a storm of fire though her shoulder - but at least plasma wounds were self-cauterising and she was not losing blood.
<<else>>The Mantis groaned to a start.  She shifted it into drive just as the men came running out of the transit, shouting at her. She gave them a wave as she put her foot down, turned sharply to the right, and accelerated towards Landing.
She heard the report of their rifles as they took shots at the Mantis, but its armour was designed to resist small arms fire like that.
<<endif>>
She followed the transit tracks, keeping a steady speed and made it to [[Landing|Toytown]] in little over an hour.

passages.name: Made A Deal
passages.text:
Tanya retrieved the cylinder from the locker at the spaceport, and took it quickly to the Lucians, keen to get the exchange over, and get on with her life.
'You have returned. Do you have the device?'
'Yes. Here you go.'
'[[Thank you|Lucians Win]].'

passages.name: sprinted for the vehicle
passages.text: Shouts and plasma bolts; her ruse had been discovered! A third plasma bolt caught her in the shoulder, as she scrambled into the cab.\nIt was an old Mantis K32, she noticed, modified for desert use. The armour should protect her from small arms fire - although given the age and state of it, that was not certain. Clearly the men had come to the same conclusion, they were running towards her.\nShe had to [[get out of here|Drive To Landing]]!

passages.name: Renege On Lucians
passages.text:
Tanya took a left, heading away from the spaceport. Two men were definitely following her. She broke into a run, and they followed suit. <>Her shoulder was starting to hurt again. She would have considered turning to confront them; if she was fit and caught them by surprise, she would have fancied her chances. She turned another corner, hoping to shake them off. 'Shit.' Dead end. She tried a couple of doors, both locked, so turned to face them. 'The Lucians'll want me alive,' she said. Either the two men did not believe her or or did not care. Two plasma bolts a moment later, and Tanya was a burnt corpse in a back alley.
Rating: 7/10
Tanya died, but not until a good way through, and the Lucians failed to get the god-device. At least for now. Could have been much worse.
<>When she had been in the corps, Tanya had been able to run for miles, but that was a few years ago. She wondered how fit her pursuers were. She saw a couple of cops on speeder bikes ahead; she could let them deal with it. 'Hey,' she shouted, 'those guys are chasing me.' <>The cops quickly sized up the situation, and pulled out their guns. And pointed them at Tanya. 'You hold it right there, miss.' 'No, no. You've got it all wrong. Those two, not me, they're trying to kill me.' She glanced back. The men had stopped running, and were doing their best to look innocent, whilst at the same time both edging away, and watching her. 'Put you hands on the bike please, miss. Nice and slow. Half the cops in the city are out looking for the girl who smashing through an official roadblock in an armoured vehicle.' 'Oh, shit.' It was two weeks later before everything was sorted, and Tanya was released after paying a hefty fine. By then the locker had been raided and the silver cylinder taken.
Rating: 6/10
Tanya survived, but the god-device was lost, taken by the Lucians to enslave all sentient races. Never a good thing.
<>The cops looked Tanya up and down, clearly liking the shorts and skimpy top. 'Don't you worry, miss, we'll sort them out.' They drew their guns, and aimed at the two men, who had stopped running, and were backing away. 'That's it guys, you keep moving,' said the other cop. 'You want a ride anywhere, miss?' Tanya scored a ride back to the [[spaceport|Spaceport After Lucian]], but then she had to get rid of Ryan, the cop, who was taking his duties a bit //too// far. A quick peck on the cheek and a fake name and number was all he was getting. <>The cops looked Tanya up and down, trying to decide if she was more trouble than the men. 'Okay, lady, we'll sort this out.' Apparently they felt she was less trouble; she tried not to be insulted. The two men were backing off under the watchful eye of the cops, and as soon as they were a decent distance, Tanya headed off the opposite, before circling back to the [[spaceport|Spaceport After Lucian]].<><>

passages.name: Find Out About Men
passages.text: After pocketing the key from the dashboard, Tanya cautiously slipped out of the Mantis. It had stopped in a military-style camp; there were five grey tents, another Mantis that looked like it was under repair, and a couple of speeder bikes. Behind the tents, she could see a trailer with a couple of microwave dishes on top. Should she head for [[the tents|The Tents]], [[the trailers|The Trailers]] or [[the other Mantis|The Other Mantis]]? she wondered.\n

passages.name: Nguyen Attack
passages.text:
Tanya leapt at the man, seeing the surprise in his face. He pulled the trigger, and a plasma bolt narrowly missed her head, but she was on him now, grappling the gun from him.
<<if visitedTag("Waitress")>>Suddenly he went limp, and Tanya looked up to see Rochelle was holding a short length of steel tube. 'You looked like you needed a hand. Did he get you?'
Tanya flexed her shoulder as she stood. 'No, not quick enough to get me.'
'So are you up to [[Descent]]?' Tanya thought about her bed in the [[hotel room|Back To Hotel]].
<<else>><<if visitedTag("HotelAttack")>>A swift knee to his groin distracted him enough for her to get the gun pointed his way. It discharged, and suddenly he went limp. Another kick to the balls confirmed he was out cold, if not actually dead. Now, what to do with the body? She dragged it into the shower for now, and tagged the door; "Do not disturb". That would give her a bit of time. Perhaps it was time to leave Kostam III, she wondered as she decided [[what to wear|Get Dressed]].
<<else>>A swift knee to his groin distracted him enough for her to get the gun pointed his way. It discharged, and suddenly he went limp. Tanya was not sure if he was dead, and was not keen on hanging around to find out. She quickly got to her feet, and headed [[back to her hotel|Back To Hotel]] by a circuitous route.<<endif>><<endif>>

passages.name: Give it to us
passages.text: Tanya knew she either handed the item over, or they killed her and they got it anyway. 'I guess I have no choice.' With a sense of foreboding, Tanya handed over the silver cylinder.\n'[[Thank you|Lucians Win]].'

passages.name: Attack Other Two
passages.text:
Tanya quickly checked the plasma rifle; 47 bolts should be enough to finish this. A gun discharged, and she automatically dropped to the ground. The other men were in the transit unit; they must have shot the other woman. Tanya crept closer, and looked inside. They were searching for something - the package the woman had given her maybe. Tanya was not in the mood to take prisoners. She aimed at the nearest man, and fired. The plasma ripped through his chest, throwing him to the floor, but his friend had ducked out of sight.
Suddenly he reappeared, gun blazing plasma. Tanya dived to the side, but knew she had been hit - her left shoulder felt like it was on fire, and she could smell burnt flesh.
But the man was exposed now, and Tanya wasted no time firing off four bolts. Her aim was a little low, but it was enough to floor him, and as she stood, she finished him off, his [[burned body|Check Body]] lying next to his colleague's. Now the [[grey vehicle|Head To Vehicle]] was hers.

passages.name: Nguyen Give Cylinder
passages.text:
<> 'Okay,' said Tanya, 'but I don't have it on me.' 'Let's go get it then.' <> 'Rochelle stays here.' 'No!' 'Please, Rochelle, it'll be dangerous.' 'Sure,' he said, 'I've no interest in her. Now get going.' <> They headed to the spaceport as Tanya wondered whether she could [[overpower him|Overpower Him]] on the way, or was she best [[just doing as he said|Nguyen Give Cylinder 2]]? <> 'Okay,' said Tanya, 'you can have the cylinder.' She handed it over to him.
Rating: 5/10
Tanya failed, but she did survive and you got some way though, I guess.
<>

passages.name: The Woman Opposite
passages.text:
'Hi,' said Tanya, 'you one of them archaeologist types?'
The woman looked up, apparently surprised that anyone had spoken to her. 'What? Oh, yes. I'm an archaeologist.' She seemed a little flustered.
'Found anything interesting?'
'What makes you say that?'
'You spend all day digging; I guess sometimes you find stuff. No point digging otherwise.'
'Oh. Oh, yes, of course. We've found... a few things.'
Suddenly there was a loud bang somewhere ahead of the transit unit. Tanya heard the brakes squealing, and then a sudden impact threw her against the front of the unit. Tanya wildly grabbed a handrail, and hung on as the transit unit tumbled end over end. It came to rest at last, a [[tangled mess|A Tangled Mess]] of steel and plastic.

passages.name: Professor Manigault
passages.text:
Before leaving the office, Tanya asked where Professor Manigault was. He had an office on the floor below, and turned out to be a large man not much older than Tanya.
'Hi, I don't know if you heard, but Professor Kimura is dead.'
'What? Is this some kind of joke? Who are you anyway?'
'It's no joke.' Tanya explained what had happened. 'She gave me this just before she died.' She showed the professor the silver cylinder.
He shrugged. 'A metal cylinder. So what?'
'She said. "Tell Jamal he was right."'
'Really? No, it couldn't be. Can I..?' Tanya let him take the cylinder. 'But how would she've known? Let me just try something...' He just held the cylinder for several minutes, deep in thought. Tanya was about to say something, when he said: 'Pretend you're a chicken.'
'What?' she started to say, then stopped. He was different, glowing with power and majesty. Holy. She was nothing before him, and yet he had noticed her - and he wanted her to be a chicken. She would willingly do anything for this immense being. 'Cluck, cluck, cluck,' she said, arms akimbo, flapping.
And suddenly it was just Professor Manigault. 'What the hell?'
'A demonstration of its power.'
'That's... scary.'
'Hell, yes. Look, you better take it. I... I'm not sure I should. You would've done anything for me.'
Tanya took the cylinder gingerly. 'I... don't know what to say. Thanks for the demo. I think. I guess [[I better go|Leave The University]].'

passages.name: To the Lucians
passages.text: The woman led Tanya to a low building, perhaps a lock-up, ten minutes walk away, the two goons following behind. They went inside, and the woman pointed to a door. 'Through there.'\nTanya walked into the [[indicated room|Lucians Meeting]].'

passages.name: Keep running
passages.text:
Her shoulder hurt like hell, slowing her down, and she could hear the men getting closer. More plasma bolts, one hitting her thigh, and she fell to the ground. Two more shots, and she was dead.
Rating: 6/10
Tanya died.

passages.name: Greed And Lust
passages.text:
'We have evolved further than the other races. The concerns of the flesh were discarded long ago.'
'Did the entire population choose to do that?' Tanya quite enjoyed many concerns of the flesh, and doubted humans would give them up unanimously.
'Oh, there were many who chose not to - it was up to each individual. But that was centuries ago. Those who kept their fleshy bodies died long ago.'
'What about their children, and children's children?'
'They all died out a long time ago.'
That did not sound like it was necessarily old age that killed them. 'How exactly did they die?'
'All who chose to keep the flesh chose ultimately to die. Now do we [[have a deal|Pay For It]]?'
Tanya was [[not so sure|No Deal]] she wanted to give the cylinder to a race like them.

passages.name: Nguyen Quiet Drink
passages.text:
'Look, I'm just here for a quiet drink. If you want to buy me one, that's fine, but then go away.'
The man shrugged. 'Hey, I was just asking. No harm in trying.' He headed back to the bar. At least he had not been any trouble; so often they liked to push their luck.
Tanya finished her drink, and the [[pretty waitress|Nguyen Waitress]] came across to her table. 'Can I get you [[another|Nguyen Another]],' she said, as she picked up the empty glass. Tanya wondered if she should head back to the [[hotel|Nguyen Outside]].

passages.name: Back To Hotel
passages.text: Back in the hotel, Tanya quickly undressed and collapsed in the bed. She was asleep in minutes.\n\nHer alarm woke her the following morning. The events of the previous day churning through her mind, she got out of bed, and started to [[get dressed|Get Dressed]] .

passages.name: Check Body
passages.text: Tanya spent a few moments searching the bodies for anything to identify them. Not much, but they were probably mercenaries doing the job for cash. She did, however, find a dogtag with an ident code on.\n'God-damn planet,' she muttered as she realised she had no signal. This had to be the only planet in civilised space that did not have global net coverage. At least she had the [[grey vehicle|Head To Vehicle]].\n

passages.name: Nguyen Waitress
passages.text:
'So what time do you finish work,' asked Tanya.
'It's usually the guys who say that.'
'You're a pretty girl. So how about it?'
<<if visitedTag("Disguised") >>The waitress looked Tanya up and down. 'You're dressed like a student, but you don't act like one. You look like the sort of woman who finds trouble.'
<<else>>The waitress looked Tanya up and down. 'You look like the sort of woman who finds trouble.'
<<endif>>'It finds me.'
The waitress smiled. 'I bet. Sure, why not? I finish at ten. You want another drink while you wait? I'm still going to charge you for it!'
'Cool. I'm Tanya, by the way.'
'Rochelle.' Rochelle got Tanya a second double scotch, then got back to work.
Shortly after ten, Rochelle came back. 'Hi. So I',m done here. You wanna go somewhere?'
'Sure. I've not been on the planet long, show me the nightlife.'
<<if visitedTag("Disguised") >>'Let's [[go to Descent|Descent]].'
They headed out of the bar, and Rochelle led the way to the nightclub.
<<else>>'Let's [[go to Descent|Nguyen Outside]].'
They headed out of the bar.<<endif>>

passages.name: Nguyen Give Cylinder 2
passages.text:
At the spaceport, Tanya opened the locker, and took out the cylinder. 'There you go. Now get the hell out of my life.' 'No problem, I just wanted this.'
Rating: 5/10
Tanya failed, but she did survive and you got some way though, I guess.

passages.name: Usquil-da Package
passages.text:
'The package, yes. You know of the Relv'gat?'
<<if visitedTag("Ancient") >>
'Ancient race, lived here million years ago? What of them?'
<<else>>
'No.'
'A race that ruled the galaxy about a million years ago. Their ruins are scattered across this planet.'
'Really? Okay.'
<<endif>>
'They visited many of the races that today have spaceflight, and changed them. Made them susceptible to religion, make them think humanoids with wings are holy.'
'Like angels.'
'Exactly. They sought to enslave all the up and coming races by convincing them they were the angels of god.'
'I guess it didn't work.'
'They died out. No one is quite sure why, though there are plenty of theories. But I believe the package you were given contains the god-mechanism.'
'The what?'
'Put simply, a control system that 99% of the intelligent species in the galaxy are genetically programmed to obey.'
'With all due respect, why would I give it to you?'
'So we can deprogram all those races. Only the Usquil are immune in this part of the galaxy, and part of the programming is a resistance to being deprogrammed.'
'That's just crazy.'
'That is your programming talking.'
'Okay, why are you immune?'
'The Relv'gat missed us. We had no purpose-made tools, certainly no fire as you can imagine, nothing to flag us up as trouble to come.'
Tanya wondered how a marine race would ever develop technology. 'Okay, I guess that at least makes sense.'

passages.name: Nguyen Start
passages.text:
Nguyen's Bar was loud and lively. A song with a thumping bass-line was playing - not one she recognised though. The bar down the right-hand side was long, and most people were sat or stood at it; the tables down the left were not so popular.
Tanya ordered herself a double scotch from a pretty waitress in white top and black skirt, then sat at an empty table, to sip her drink and think about what she was going to do.<<if visitedTag("Injured")>> Lucky it was not her drinking arm that had taken the shot.<<endif>>
Some 15 minutes later, a man came over to her. She looked him up and down; shaven head, loose shirt and pants in matching green. He was not exactly handsome, but he had an interesting face, and the bluest eyes.
'Hi,' he said., 'can I get you a drink?' Why did guys always assume a woman on her own was just after a [[one-night stand|Nguyen ONS]]? Sometimes a girl just wanted [[a quiet drink|Nguyen Quiet Drink]].

passages.name: Fail To Sabotage The Reactor
passages.text:
The Helios microreactor was so successful in part because it was so difficult to sabotage; they had been known to survive even a plasma cannon - not in working condition, but without exploding. Fortunately, Tanya knew a trick or two; you just had to be a bit more subtle. As she had suspected, they were only using 3% of its potential. She heard some shouting, something about a key. Damn, they had realised someone had taken the key. A minute later, the door to the trail was pulled open, and two men were aiming plasma rifles at her. 'I surrender...' she said, even as they shot her dead.
Rating: 1/10
Tanya failed and died.

passages.name: Left Luggage
passages.text: The spaceport was just outside the city, but not a long walk and not worth getting a transit; she was not sure they would even be running yet. She found an empty locker, set a code on the lock, and placed the cylinder and note, now back in the blood-soaked envelope, inside.\nNow she could go get [[that drink|Nguyen Start]]

passages.name: Yes deal
passages.text:
'Let's say 10,000 credits, and you got yourself a deal.' The woman smiled. 'You're brighter than you look. 10,000 it is then.' Despite feeling a bit offended, Tanya was happy to pocket the stack of cash.
Rating: 5/10
Tanya failed, but she did survive and made a stack of money.

passages.name: Nguyen Outside
passages.text:
Outside in the street, a man approached Tanya. It was the guy in green who had offered her a drink earlier. Now he was brandishing a gun; a Micrimaser-712 by the look of it. Not powerful, but easy to conceal, and deadly enough.
<<if visitedTag("Waitress") >>'See what I mean about trouble finding me,' Tanya said to Rochelle.
<<endif>>'It would've been easier,' said the man, 'if you'd come with me earlier.'
'I love to make things difficult.'
'Just hand over the cylinder.'
'What? I thought you wanted my body... Now I'm insulted. So how did you find me?'
'Chick in a black jumpsuit, coming in from the desert. You weren't hard to trace. Now, [[give me the cylinder|Nguyen Give Cylinder]].'
<<if visitedTag("Injured")>>
Tanya eyed him up. He was probably not expecting her to [[attack him|Nguyen Attack (Injured)]], but it would be risky to say the least, especially with a her shoulder already injured.
<<else>>
Tanya eyed him up. He was probably not expecting her to [[attack him|Nguyen Attack]]... 
<<endif>>

passages.name: Stowaway 2
passages.text: It was 43 minutes later when the vehicle stopped. The Mantis had a top speed of about 75 km/h over this terrain, Tanya reckoned, which put her 50 to 55 klicks from the transit unit. The vehicle wobbled once... twice... three times as the men climbed out, and she could at last get out of the storage bin. Should she [[take the Mantis|Take The Mantis]] now while she had the chance, or try to [[find out about the men|Find Out About Men]]?\n

passages.name: Descent
passages.text:
Descent was apparently the only decent nightclub on the planet, and Rochelle clearly came here a lot; she was well-known to the bouncers.
<<if visitedTag("Injured") >>Inside was busy, hot and loud. They spent an hour or so dancing, before the pain in Tanya's shoulder got too great, and then headed back to Tanya's hotel room.
<<else>>Inside was busy, hot and loud. They spent a few hours listening to tracks mostly from the twenty-second century, then headed back to Tanya's hotel room.
<<endif>>In the morning Rochelle had to go; she was doing a xenohistory course at the university. 'I'm going to have to go to class in my waitress uniform!'
<<if visitedTag("Ancients") >>'So what can you tell me about the Relv'gat?' asked Tanya as she watched Rochelle get dressed.
'They were around about a million years ago,' she said as she pulled on her skirt. 'The galaxy was ruled by about five different races, and they had this huge war, and the Relv'gat won, but they then disappeared soon after. Er, soon after as in tens of thousands of years. Their ruins are scattered throughout the galaxy, but some of the best preserved are on Kostom III, because the planet's so dead. Look, I really have to go. It was fun.'
<<endif>>After Rochelle had gone, Tanya thought about [[getting dressed|Get Dressed]] herself.

passages.name: Pay For It
passages.text:
<<if visitedTag("TenFold") >>
'Seems to me,' said Tanya, 'that you'd be willing to pay a lot to be gods. Like 10,000 credits.'
'You ask a great deal.'
'I do. But I guess I'm cursed with greed.'
<<else>>
'Seems to me,' said Tanya, 'that you'd be willing to pay a lot for this little thing. Like 1,000 credits.'
'You ask a great deal.'<<endif>>
There was a curious high-pitched whining, then; 'Very well, we agree. Now we will transfer the credits to your account.'
<<if visitedTag("LeftLuggage") >>
Tanya passed her details to them with her wrist-phone, then watched her account balance jump. 'Great. I'll go [[get it for you|Get It For Lucians]].'
'Do not think about crossing us. You will be hunted down before you have spent a single credit.'
'Never crossed my mind,' she lied.
<<else>>
Tanya passed her details to them with her wrist-phone, then watched her account balance jump. 'Great. I'll go get it for you.'
'You will hand it over now. We know you are carrying it.'
'Oh, right. That god-device.' With a sense of foreboding, Tanya handed over the silver cylinder.
'[[Thank you|Lucians Win]].'
<<endif>>

passages.name: back2
passages.text: data:image/png;base64,

passages.name: Lucians Meeting
passages.text:
In the centre of the room, three glowing orbs were floating. As soon as she saw them, Tanya felt a kind of awe; for a moment they were the most beautiful things she had ever seen. No, she reminded herself, they were just aliens; aliens who had ordered the attack on the transit unit. 'So you're Lucians?'
'We are.' The voice seemed to come from the middle orb. 'You are Tanya? You have the device?'
'I know where it is.'
<<if visitedTag("LeftLuggage") >>'We have been searching for such a device for a very long time. We would like you to hand it over.'
If they were desperate, they would be willing to [[pay well for it|Pay For It]], but Tanya wondered exactly [[what they wanted it for|Lucians Want It]].<<else>>One of the orbs, the one on the left, floated nearer to her, descending to about knee level, before rising to her waist. 'She has it on her.'
'Good,' said the first orb. '[[Give it to us]], and we will let you live.' Tanya was not sure she had any [[other options|Other options]].<<endif>>

passages.name: Attack
passages.text: Maybe she could even the odds? It sounded like they were splitting up, coming round either side of the transit unit. Taking the knife from her boot, Tanya headed right, to find one on his own. 'Please, help,' she gasped, pretending to stagger. As he approached, she flicked out her knife, skewering him through the chin.  He fell to his knees quietly, gurgling and clutching at his throat before face-planting into the sand. She picked up his gun. Now, did she try to [[take out the other two|Attack Other Two]], or [[head for the vehicle|Head To Vehicle]]?\n

passages.name: The Trailers
passages.text: Tanya sneaked around the back of the tents, to the trailers. One was locked - probably where they kept their weapons and ammo. The other, with the two dishes on the top, was not. Thick cables snaked out from it to the tents, partly under the sand. She slipped inside. It was dark after the harsh light outside, and smelt of ozone. Tanya took off her shades, and waited a few moments for her eyes to adjust. At the back of the trailer there was a microreactor; that would be the power source for the camp. On the left, a cabinet held the communication electronics. It was all Helios Industries equipment; pretty much standard for mercenaries across space.\nUnless she wanted to [[sabotage the reactor|Sabotage The Reactor]], there was not a lot here. <<if visited("The Tents")>>Perhaps she should just [[leave the camp|Take The Mantis]] while she could.<<else>>Should she investigate [[the tents|The Tents]], or just [[leave the camp|Take The Mantis]] now?<<endif>>

passages.name: No deal
passages.text:
'Sorry lady, no deal,' said Tanya. 'Sentimental value and all that.'
'You'll be sorry.'
'Yeah, well I can live with that.'
'Living might not be an option.' The woman turned and walked away.
Tanya shrugged. She wondered what to do next. What she did know was that she really needed was a drink. [[Nguyen's Bar|Nguyen Start]] was near her hotel.
Would it be wise to leave the object in a [[locker at the spaceport|Left Luggage]] first?

passages.name: Begin
passages.text: The doors slid shut, and the transit unit rapidly accelerated, leaving Base 42, and heading out across [[the great desert|The Great Plain]]. As Tanya settled back in her seat, she glanced at the [[woman opposite|The Woman Opposite]]. Some professor from the dig, she guessed; probably in her fifties, and dressed in a pale grey suit that might have been fashionable a decade ago.\n

passages.name: Other options
passages.text: Tanya thought quickly. The men in the other room were all armed, but not the woman. Did the Lucians have any combat ability? She just had to hope not.\n'I suppose I have no choice...' she said as she walked over to the woman. The she pretty much threw the woman into the Lucians, and made a [[dash for the door|Dash for door]].\nBehind her she could heard the woman scream, and shout; 'Stop the bitch!'

passages.name: Make a run for it
passages.text:
'Fuck you,' said Tanya as she started to sprint.
'Shoot her,' said the woman, to the two men.
A plasma bolt flew over her head, and around Tanya people were scurrying to get out the way. 
She could hear the men running after her. More plasma bolts flew past her, then one hit her left shoulder, knocking her to the ground. Perhaps she should [[surrender|Give up]]; [[running|Keep running]] looked hopeless.

passages.name: Credits
passages.text:
This game is entirely the creative work of Andy Joel (copyright 2014-16), using Twine 1.4.2 and SugarCube. Thanks to their respective authors for making this game possible.
Thanks also to the beta-testers: XanMag, Phil McGrail, Elyne Knight and Owlor
There is a mixture of choices in this game. There are pages with only one choice, there are sudden death choices (though you will be warned of them) and there are meaningless choices where it does not really matter which you choose. However, there are plenty of choices that do matter, and will determine how the story goes later on.
At each ending you will get a rating out of 10; there is also a special ending that will get you 11... Remember you can always undo an action using your browser "Back" button.
Now we can [[begin|Begin]]...

passages.name: Background
passages.text:
Vehicle: Mantis K32
Planet: Kostam III
City: Landing
Aliens employing mercs: Fucians
Station: Base 42
she comes from Mars
Package to Prof Jenssen, from Prof Kimura
Ancient aliens: Relv'gat
Squid: Usquil-da
Professor Jamal Manigault

passages.name: Leave The Package
passages.text:
Tanya left the package in the office. A few days later she heard there had been a burglary at the university, but that was none of her business.
Rating: 4/10
Tanya failed, but she did survive.

passages.name: Jump Ship
passages.text:
There was a shuttle leaving for Station Alpha within the hour, Tanya discovered, and a starliner called the Mercy Dash already docked there. Tanya bought a ticket; apparently the Mercy Dash was heading to Ligrand IV next. She could change ships there and perhaps change her appearance too. Later she could find a way to destroy the device - tossing it into a star would be good. Six hours later she was in a cramped room on the Mercy Dash, vowing never to return to Kostam III.
Rating: 10/10
Tanya survived, and the galaxy has been saved from the Lucians! Congratulations!

passages.name: Get Everything Straightened Out
passages.text:
'No problem.' Tanya stepped out of the Transit. The cops looked nervous. 'It's okay, I'm unarmed.'
'Is that your vehicle?'
'Er, not exactly.' Tanya explained what had happened.
'You're going to have to give a full report, little lady, down at the station.'
'Can I do that later?'
After seeing her ID, the cops were happy for her to do the report the next day - but the Mantis was taken off her. She would have had to pay a fortune to get it back to Mars anyway.
She started to [[walk to the university|Walk To Uni]].

passages.name: Make a run for it (injured)
passages.text:
'Fuck you,' said Tanya as she started to sprint. 'Shoot her,' said the woman, to the two men. A plasma bolt flew over her head, and around Tanya people were scurrying to get out the way. Her shoulder hurt like hell, slowing her down, and she could hear the men getting closer. More plasma bolts, one hitting her thigh, and she fell to the ground. Two more shots, and she was dead.
Rating: 6/10
Tanya died.

passages.name: Lucians Win
passages.text:
Any unease Tanya felt about the Lucians having the cylinder quickly evaporated, as she comprehended what they were. These beings were gods! She would give her life for them a thousand times over. 'Tanya?' They had noticed her; her heart fluttered. 'Yes, wondrous one?' <> 'Transfer 10,000 credits from your account to ours.' <> 'Transfer 1,000 credits from your account to ours.' <> 'Of course, great ones.' It was such a blessing that they had noticed her, an insignificant speck. Quickly she did as she was instructed. 'What else may I do to please you, all powerful ones?' 'You shall be the first of our missionaries.' For the rest of her life, Tanya toured the galaxy, spreading the word, leaving peace and happiness wherever she went.
Rating: 8/10
Well, everyone is happy, I suppose... And she did survive.

passages.name: Get It For Lucians
passages.text: Tanya headed to the spaceport. The further she got from the Lucians, the less she liked them. Was this the god-mechanism hard-wired to her brain, she wondered? It was tempting to [[renege on the Lucians|Renege On Lucians]], even to jump on a ship and get as far away from here as possible, but she had [[made a deal|Made A Deal]].\nThose two goons were definitely following her. She wondered what had happened to the woman.

passages.name: Take the woman
passages.text: Three men emerged from the vehicle as Tanya was trying to haul the unconscious woman out of the transit unit. One of them shouted, as he shouldered his rifle.
