Tanya dropped the woman - she would be lucky to get out of this alive herself - and ducked round the side of the wreckage.\nHer best bet was to circle round, and take their vehicle. She had to hope they would not think to split up, and come round both sides of the transit unit.\n'I surrender,' she shrieked, doing her best hysterical voice. 'I surrender. Please don't hurt me.' Hoping that would convince them she was not going to move, she quickly skirted round the tangled metal, then [[sprinted for the vehicle]].

passages.name: Invite Oscar To Hotel
passages.text:
'It's getting late,' said Tanya, 'I should really be getting back to my hotel. You want to come with me?' 'Sure.' <>She awoke the next morning to find Oscar looking at her. 'Last night was great, but I better get going.' Tanya propped herself up in bed and watched him get dressed. The worst part of a one-night stand was the awkwardness the next day, so she said nothing. Before he left he gave her a quick kiss, without bothering to lie about seeing her again soon, which was nice. Now she could [[get dressed|Get Dressed]] herself. <><>She awoke the next morning to find Oscar pointing a gun at her. 'It would've been easier,' he said, 'if you'd had the cylinder here, and I could've just taken it, and you could get on with your life.' 'I love to make things difficult.' 'So where is?' 'Everything last night, that was just to get the damn cylinder?' He smiled. 'Of course. Not that it wasn't fun.' 'So how did you find me?' 'Chick in a black jumpsuit, poking around the university. You weren't hard to trace. Now, [[give me the cylinder|Nguyen Give Cylinder]].' <>Tanya eyed him up. He was probably not expecting her to [[attack him|Nguyen Attack (Injured)]], but it would be risky to say the least, especially with her shoulder already injured. <>Tanya eyed him up. He was probably not expecting her to [[attack him|Nguyen Attack]]... <><>She awoke the next morning to find both Oscar and the cylinder gone. 'Damn.'
Rating: 5/10
Tanya failed, but she did survive and you got some way though, I guess.
<> <>

passages.name: Knife Fight
passages.text:
One of the thugs made a grab, and got a slashed hand for his trouble. She cut another on the arm, before a third had a hold of her knife hand. He took a sharp kick to the balls, but kept hold, and in moments she was on the floor under them. Her knife was tossed aside, and the cylinder handed to the Lucians. And suddenly all her confusion evaporated, as she comprehended what they were. These beings were gods! She would give her life for them a thousand times over. 'Kneel!' Surely they were not talking to her? Yes, they really were. She and the mercenaries all knelt. 'You shall be our first missionaries...' For the rest of her life, Tanya toured the galaxy, spreading the word, leaving peace and happiness wherever she went.
Rating: 9/10
Well, everyone is happy, I suppose... And she did survive.

passages.name: Become A God
passages.text:
<>The silver cylinder. The god device. She had seen Professor Manigault use it; how hard could it be? 'Kneel!' She channelled her voice, her mind, through the device. <>Both<>All five of<> the mercenaries dropped to their knees, looking up at her with strange smiles. 'So you have discovered its power,' said the Lucian. 'As you see, it has no effect on us.' 'Why not?' 'It uses a genetic key the Relv'gat inserted into your DNA. They did similar to us, but since we transcended the flesh, we are no longer susceptible.' 'Kill the Lucians,' said Tanya, through the device. The mercenaries almost fell over themselves in their eagerness. <>At first they landed ineffectual blows, then one<>Four landed ineffectual blows, but the boss<> produced an electronic device from his pack that was decidedly effective; the three Lucians deflated like punctured balloons with a shrill scream. Mercenary insurance, Tanya supposed. It was over. The Lucians were dead, the mercenaries subdued... And she had in her hand the means to rule this miserable planet, and more besides, perhaps.
Rating: 11/10
A perfect result for Tanya; within a few years, the entire galaxy worships her as a god! For enslaved humanity, not so much.
<> <><>The silver cylinder. The god device. She had been carrying it all this time, and suddenly she understood what it was. 'Kneel!' She channelled her voice, her mind, through the device. <>Both<>All five of<> the mercenaries dropped to their knees, looking up at her with strange smiles. 'So you have discovered its power,' said the Lucian. 'As you see, it has no effect on us.' 'Why not?' 'It uses a genetic key the Relv'gat inserted into your DNA. They did similar to us, but since we transcended the flesh, we are no longer susceptible.' 'Kill the Lucians,' said Tanya, through the device. The mercenaries almost fell over themselves in their eagerness. <>At first theyu landed ineffectual blows, then one<>Four landed ineffectual blows, but the boss<> produced an electronic device from his pack that was decidedly effective; the three Lucians deflated like punctured balloons with a shrill scream. Mercenary insurance, Tanya supposed. It was over. The Lucians were dead, the mercenaries subdued... And she had in her hand the means to rule this miserable planet, and more besides, perhaps.
Rating: 11/10
A perfect result for Tanya; within a few years, the entire galaxy worships her as a god! For enslaved humanity, not so much.
<> The silver cylinder. The cause of all her problems. If only there was some way to use it to her advantage! In desperation she threw it at one of the thugs. He batted it aside, and it fell to the floor, to be scooped up by the mercenary leader. He promptly handed it to the Lucians. And suddenly all her confusion evaporated, as she comprehended what they were. These beings were gods! She would give her life for them a thousand times over. 'Kneel!' Surely they were not talking to her? Yes, they really were. She and the mercenaries all knelt. 'You shall be our first missionaries...' For the rest of her life, Tanya toured the galaxy, spreading the word, leaving peace and happiness wherever she went.
Rating: 9/10
Well, everyone is happy, I suppose... And she did survive.

He batted it aside, and it fell to the floor, to be scooped up by the mercenary leader. He promptly handed it to the Lucians. And suddenly all her confusion evaporated, as she comprehended what they were. These beings were gods! She would give her life for them a thousand times over. 'Kneel!' Surely they were not talking to her? Yes, they really were. She and the mercenaries all men knelt. 'You shall be our first missionaries...' For the rest of her life, Tanya toured the galaxy, spreading the word, leaving peace and happiness wherever she went.
Rating: 9/10
Well, everyone is happy, I suppose... And she did survive.
<><>

passages.name: Head To Pyramid
passages.text: Tanya caught the transit to Pyramid Plot. Twenty minutes out of Landing, the unit slowed and everyone looked out of the window at the wreckage at the side of the track and the transit company robots that were waiting for the unit to pass before they continued repairing the track.\nThe unit stopped briefly at Base 42, where Tanya had got on only the day before, though it felt like a decade ago. Then two more stops to [[Pyramid Plot]].\nAs they got close, she could see the eponymous pyramid. Made of the ubiquitous turquoise stone, it pointed at the blue sky, as it had presumably done for a million years.

passages.name: Get Everything Straightened Out (Fail)
passages.text:
'No problem.' Tanya stepped out of the Transit. The cops looked nervous. 'It's okay, I'm unarmed.' 'According to our reports, you just left a small nuclear explosion in that there vehicle.' 'Oh, that.' This might take longer to sort out than Tanya had thought. It took two weeks, during which she was in gaol the whole time. The package was taken off her, and that was the last she saw or heard of it, though she was told it would be delivered to the university.
Rating: 3/10
Tanya failed, but at least she survived.

passages.name: Offices
passages.text:
Tanya tried the door to the central cargo-pod. It opened, and she stepped inside, and immediately realised something was wrong; she could smell death. She looked around; doorways left and right were signposted "Artefacts" and "Office", and stairs to the upper pod was "Living Quarters". Against the far wall there were several lockers. For a few moments she listened carefully, but could hear nothing. 
Tanya walked cautiously into the "Artefacts" pod. She had imagined this would be where they stored the items they found, but it turned out to be where they processed them. One area was set up for photography, another for cleaning.  Although the camera was connected to a computer, the computer was locked, so that was another dead end.
Tanya walked cautiously into the "Office" pod, the smell getting worse as she did. Inside she found a basic office with three desks; a man was slumped across the nearer one. He was clearly dead. She examined him, as far as she could without touching him. She could see a blaster wound on his shoulder; not enough to kill him, but he may well have others on his chest she could not see. He had been perhaps 30, fair haired, and rather slim; dressed in green overalls.
She did not want to stay here, or to leave her fingerprints at a crime scene, but she was here for a reason. Should she try to use one of the [[computers|Access Computers]]? Perhaps she should [[report the crime|Report the Murder]], and then head for the [[pyramid|Pyramid Entrance]]?
